# Summary

Due to missing variant types, analysis combines ten copies of hotdeck imputed datasets. Events are not considered competing risk.



```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis'}

show.q=F

for (tpeak in rev(tt)) { # 22 and 43
  
for (j in 2) { # 1 for M12 and 2 for M6
    
  cat("# D", tpeak, ifelse(j==1, " M12", " M6"), "\n\n", sep="")
  
for (iSt in 1:2) {
  
  if (iSt==1) subfolder <- "stage1nnaive"
  if (iSt==2) subfolder <- "stage2nnaive"

  cat("## ", subfolder, "\n\n")
      
  if (iSt==1) ii=1:2 # 1 is for bAb and 2 is for nAb 
  if (iSt==2) ii=1:3 # add a sensitivity study for stage 2, non-naive, nAb
  
  for (i in ii) {
    tmp=switch(i, '1'='bAb', '2'='nAb', '3'='st2.nAb.sen')
    
    cat("### Day ", tpeak, ifelse(j==1, " M12", " M6"), " ", tmp, "\n\n")

    # D43vat08_combined_M12_bAb
    COR0 <- paste0("D", tpeak, "vat08_combined_M", ifelse(j==1, 12, 6), "_", tmp)
    
    config.cor <- config::get(config = COR0)
    for(opt in names(config.cor)) eval(parse(text = paste0(names(config.cor[opt])," <- config.cor[[opt]]")))
    special.note = paste0("$\\ddagger$ Count Omicron cases starting 7 days post Day ", tpeak, ".")
    
    if (i==1) {
      assays1=assays[startsWith(assays,'bind')]
    } else if (i==2 | i==3) {
      assays1=assays[startsWith(assays,'pseudo')]
    }

    # modify pathCoRoutput and COR to include subfolder name. 
    # Changes to COR will also show up in Section title in report_by_COR.Rmd
    COR <- paste0("M", ifelse(j==1, 12, 6), "_", switch(i, '1'='bAb', '2'='nAb', '3'='st2.nAb.sen'))
    pathCoRoutput <- paste0("cor_coxph/output/", TRIAL, "/", COR0, "/", subfolder)
  
  
    level=4 # section title indent
    
    fname.suffix = "D" %.% tpeak
    all.markers = c(paste0("Day", tpeak, assays1), paste0("Delta", tpeak, "overB", assays1), paste0("B", assays1)); names(all.markers)=all.markers
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
      # tertile incidence curves
      fname.suffix = "D" %.% tpeak
      all.markers = c(paste0("Day", tpeak, assays1), paste0("Delta", tpeak, "overB", assays1)); names(all.markers)=all.markers
      res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_tertilecurves.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
      cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
    # placebo Dxx
    fname.suffix="D" %.% tpeak %.% "_plac"
    all.markers=c(paste0("Day", tpeak, assays1)); names(all.markers)=all.markers
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
      # tertile incidence curves
      fname.suffix = "D" %.% tpeak %.% "plac"
      all.markers = c(paste0("Day", tpeak, assays1)); names(all.markers)=all.markers
      res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_tertilecurves.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
      cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
    if (iSt==1) {
      # placebo Dxx with a subset of countries for stage 1
      fname.suffix="D" %.% tpeak %.% "_plac_alt2"
      all.markers=c(paste0("Day", tpeak, assays1)); names(all.markers)=all.markers
      COR_page_notes="Analyses based on Columbia, Ghana, Kenya, Nepal, India only."
      res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
      COR_page_notes = "" # reset 
      cat(res, sep = '\n')
    }

      
    fname.suffix = "B+D" %.% tpeak
    has.alt = F
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_coef.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
    fname.suffix = "B*D" %.% tpeak
    has.alt = F
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_coef.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
    fname.suffix = "dichB*D" %.% tpeak
    has.alt = F
    coef_page_notes = paste0("dich(B) = 1 if baseline marker is high, 0 if baseline marker is low; thus the second parameter is the effect of the continuous marker in the low baseline group. The cutpoint is set to the weighted median unless the negative response rate at baseline exceeds 40% or more than 40% of the values are above the Upper Limit of Quantification (ULOQ). In these cases, the cutpoint is adjusted to the detection limit or ULOQ, respectively. Cutpoints (on the log10 scale): ", concatList(paste0("\\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/dichcutpoints_B", assays1, ".txt}"), sep=", "), ".")
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_coef.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    coef_page_notes = "" # reset 
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
    fname.suffix = "(1-dichB)*D" %.% tpeak
    has.alt = F
    coef_page_notes = paste0("dich(B) = 1 if baseline marker is high, 0 if baseline marker is low; thus the second parameter is the effect of the continuous marker in the high baseline group. The cutpooint is set to the weighted median unless the negative response rate at baseline exceeds 40% or more than 40% of the values are above the Upper Limit of Quantification (ULOQ). In these cases, the cutpoint is adjusted to the detection limit or ULOQ, respectively. Cutpoints (on the log10 scale): ", concatList(paste0("\\input{", pathCoRoutput, "/dichcutpoints_B", assays1, ".txt}"), sep=", "), ".")
    res = knitr::knit_child(c(here::here('cor_coxph', 'report_by_COR_coef.Rmd')), quiet = TRUE)
    coef_page_notes = ""
    cat(res, sep = '\n')
    
  }

            
}
}
```
